group.label: AvaTax - General
group.comment: For complete and up-to-date documentation, please visit github.com/avadev/Avalara-AvaTax-for-Magento2/blob/master/docs/getting-started.md.

field.label: Tax Mode
field.comment:
• Disabled — AvaTax tax estimation will be disabled and native Magento tax estimation will be used. Only use this option if you want to use Address Validation without tax estimation.
  • Estimate Tax — AvaTax tax estimation will run during checkout, but completed orders will not be submitted to AvaTax.
  • Estimate Tax & Submit Transactions to AvaTax — AvaTax tax estimation will run during checkout and invoices and credit memos will be submitted to AvaTax.

field.label: Commit Submitted Transactions
field.comment: Should transactions sent to AvaTax be committed? Only change to No if you have specific reason to do so.

field.label: Taxable Countries
field.comment: Select which countries to enable for tax calculation (address verification countries are configured below).

field.label: Filter Tax Calculation By Region
field.comment: Should tax calculation only apply to certain regions? Only change this to Yes if you have a specific reason to do so. See the [documentation](https://github.com/avadev/Avalara-AvaTax-for-Magento2/blob/develop/docs/sales-tax.md#filter_by_region) for more details.

field.label: Enabled Regions
field.comment: Select regions where you want AvaTax tax calculation to apply. Unselected regions will use native Magento tax calculation. If you change the selection of the Taxable Countries field, you must save this page for this region list to update.

field.label: Calculate Tax Before Discount
field.comment: Should tax be calculated on each item before discounts are applied

field.label: Mode
field.comment:
The mode you select will determine whether the Production or Development credentials will be used. You will get your Account Number, License Key, and Company Code from your AvaTax representative. If Production is selected, then https://avatax.avalara.net will be used as the API url. If Development is selected, then https://development.avalara.net will be used as the API url.

When you save this page, if you have entered credentials below for the selected mode, the AvaTax API will be pinged to ensure the credentials are working.

field.label: Company (Production)
field.comment: Choose the company to use. If you don't see values in this dropdown, then enter values into the Account Number and License Key fields above.

field.label: Company (Development)
field.comment: Choose the company to use. If you don't see values in this dropdown, then enter values into the Account Number and License Key fields above.

field.label: Customer Code Format
field.comment: Select a format for customers to be identified in AvaTax. Available options will include any customer attributes that exist in Magento. If the customer doesn't have a value defined for the selected attribute when their transaction is processed and sent to Avalara, their customer (or guest) ID will be used instead. Once the integration is live, this setting should not be changed.

field.label: UPC Attribute To Use As Item Code
field.comment: Optional. By default, this extension sends the Magento product SKU to the AvaTax ItemCode field. However if you want to use a UPC product attribute as the AvaTax ItemCode, select which attribute above maps to your UPC attribute. If a UPC attribute is present on a product, it will be used as the AvaTax ItemCode and will be prepended with "UPC: ". Otherwise the product's SKU will be sent. Sending the UPC in the ItemCode field will allow you to bypass the Avalara Tax Code selection and mapping in your product record. The UPC, when sent in the ItemCode field, maps directly to the Avalara Product Tax Code so you don’t have to map those codes separately.

field.label: Ref1 Attribute
field.comment: Optional. AvaTax allows you to pass arbitrary information into two reference fields for each line item. Select a text type product attribute to be sent to AvaTax in the Ref1 field. Only the first 250 characters of this attribute will be sent to AvaTax.

field.label: Ref2 Attribute
field.comment: Optional. AvaTax allows you to pass arbitrary information into two reference fields for each line item. Select a text type product attribute to be sent to AvaTax in the Ref2 field. Only the first 250 characters of this attribute will be sent to AvaTax.

field.label: Submit VAT Number to AvaTax
field.comment: Set this to Yes if you want to send VAT tax numbers to AvaTax to affect tax calculation. If a guest or customer has a VAT number set on their Magento shipping address, it will be used. Otherwise the Tax/VAT Number attribute value from the customer record will be used. If a VAT number is not found, nothing will be sent. The VAT number will be sent to the BusinessIdentificationNo field in AvaTax.

field.label: Location Code
field.comment: Optional, unless outlet-based reporting is needed. Location code is a value assigned by some State jurisdictions that identifies a particular store location. These States may require tax liabilities to be broken out separately for each store Location. Read more in the AvaTax documentation.

field.label: Shipping Tax Code
field.comment: The Avalara tax code used to classify the shipping service type.

field.label: Shipping SKU
field.comment: The SKU sent to denote shipping costs.

field.label: Adjustment Refund SKU
field.comment: The SKU sent to denote positive adjustments on Credit Memos.

field.label: Adjustment Fee SKU
field.comment: The SKU sent to denote negative adjustments on Credit Memos.

field.label: Gift Wrap Order SKU
field.comment: The SKU sent AvaTax to denote gift wrap order costs. Only relevant for Magento Enterprise.

field.label: Gift Wrap Items SKU
field.comment: The SKU sent AvaTax to denote gift wrap item costs. Only relevant for Magento Enterprise.

field.label: Gift Wrap Printed Card SKU
field.comment: The SKU sent to denote gift wrap printed card costs. Only relevant for Magento Enterprise.

field.label: Enable Address Validation
field.comment: Enable validation of shipping address using the AvaTax Address Validation API.

field.label: Enabled Countries
field.comment: Select which countries to enable for address validation. AvaTax Address Validation currently only supports United States and Canada.

field.label: Allow User To Choose Original (Invalid) Address
field.comment: Set this to Yes to allow the user to choose between the original and validated addresses (valid address will be selected by default). If set to No, user will be required to use the validated address or update their original address. This setting is ignored in the backend and the user will always have a choice.

field.label: Address Validation Instructions
field.comment: When user progresses to the Review & Payments step of the checkout, this text will be displayed above the Suggested Address and Original Address checkboxes.

field.label: Address Validation Instructions
field.comment: When user progresses to the Review & Payments step of the checkout, this text will be displayed above the suggested address.

field.label: Address Validation Error Instructions
field.comment: This text will be displayed when there is an error in the address validation process. The element assigned the "error-message" class will be filled with the error message summary returned by AvaTax.

field.label: Enable Duty
field.comment: Duty include duties, fees and taxes relevant to cross border shipments. This feature must be enabled in your Avalara account. Note that the proper use of this feature requires appropriate configuration of Cross Border Classes (see Stores > AvaTax > Cross Border Classes) and assignment of Cross Border Types to products.

field.label: Map Shipping Methods
field.comment: Customs tax calculations may vary based on what type of shipping method is being used. Each of the Magento enabled shipping methods must be mapped to an AvaTax Shipping Mode to ensure accurate calculations. Note that you must enable a shipping method at the currently viewed admin scope in order for it to be available here.

field.label: Ground Shipping Methods
field.comment: Select all ground shipping methods. Ensure that the shipping methods selected above are not selected in either of the other shipping method lists.

field.label: Enable Document Management
field.comment: AvaTax Document Management allows users to upload documents that verify that they’re tax exempt and if they do, they won’t be charged tax in the checkout. This feature must be enabled in your Avalara account.

field.label: Enabled Countries
field.comment: Select which countries to enable for Document Management.

field.label: Checkout Link Text: New Cert(No certs exist)
field.comment: The text of the link that appears at checkout allowing the initiation of a new certificate. This text shows if there are no existing certificates for the customer.

field.label: Checkout Link Text: New Cert(Certs exist)
field.comment: The text of the link that appears at checkout allowing the initiation of a new certificate. This text shows if there are already existing certificates for the customer.

field.label: Checkout Link Text: Manage Existing Certs
field.comment: The text of the link that appears at checkout allowing the user to navigate to certificate management in My Account. This text shows only if there are existing certificates for the customer.

field.label: Change Status name of the Certificate
field.comment: Rename Status of the Certificate

field.label: 'Approved' Status Name(Default name)
field.comment: This text will be shown instead of the default certificate status name('Approved') in the 'Tax Certificates' grid of the My Account.

field.label: 'Denied' Status Name(Default name)
field.comment: This text will be shown instead of the default certificate status name('Denied') in the 'Tax Certificates' grid of the My Account.

field.label: 'Pending' Status Name(Default name)
field.comment: This text will be shown instead of the default certificate status name('Pending') in the 'Tax Certificates' grid of the My Account.

field.label: Enable tax calculation for Adjustment Refund and Adjustment Fee
field.comment: By default, Magento does not calculate taxes for Adjustment Refund and Adjustment Fee. If this option will be enabled, AvaTax will calculate Adjustment related taxes.

field.label: Tables Exemptions List (comma-separated list)
field.comment: At each stage of ordering (adding to cart, choosing the payment address and delivery address, delivery method, etc.) the ClassyLama_Avatax extension monitors the correctness of the calculated taxes, updates their values through the Avalara service API and writes to certain tables in the database of the website.

field.label: Enable logging of AvaTax response data
field.comment: By default, AvaTax API response data for Orders, Invoices, and Credit Memo API calls are stored in the avatax_sales_order, avatax_sales_invoice, and avatax_sales_creditmemo tables. This data is stored in case there is ever a need to compare the exact response data from AvaTax with what is saved on the Magento tax fields. Disable this logging if you won't ever need this

field.label: Error Action
field.comment: What should happen if Magento is unable to retrieve taxes from the AvaTax API. Regardless of which option is selected, if there is an error in the AvaTax tax estimation, the extension will fall back to using native Magento tax rules. However if Disable checkout & show error message is selected, the extension will prevent users and admins from placing orders.

field.label: Frontend Error Message
field.comment: This error message will be displayed to user if there is an error calculating taxes and if Disable checkout & show error message is selected above.

field.label: Backend Error Message
field.comment: This error message will be displayed to admin if there is an error calculating taxes and if Disable checkout & show error message is selected above.

field.label: AvaTax API Timeout
field.comment: This field defines how long Magento should wait to hear from AvaTax's servers before assuming no response will be given.

field.label: Database Log Level
field.comment: Warning is recommended for production use.

field.label: Database Log Detail
field.comment: Minimal is recommended for production use.

field.label: Database Log Record Lifetime
field.comment: Required. Days before entries are auto-purged.

field.label: Enable Logging To File
field.comment: Archiving of log files is affected by System -> Admin Actions Log Archiving

field.label: File Log Mode
field.comment: Log files are located in the magento var/log/ directory

field.label: Enable Built-In Log File Rotation
field.comment: Automatic log file rotation will allow you to control how much history is maintained in the AvaTax log files, and separate them by day. For more efficient management of log files you should disable this option and use something like logrotate to handle the rotation of log files at the system level.

field.label: Built-In Log File Rotation Max Files
field.comment: The number of files/days to maintain in the log directory when rotating. The log file rotator will create a new file each day.

field.label: File Log Level
field.comment: Warning is recommended for production use.

field.label: File Log Detail
field.comment: Normal is recommended for production use.

field.label: Queue Processing Settings
field.comment: If Tax Mode is set to Estimate Tax & Submit Transactions to AvaTax, then queue processing is enabled. Otherwise the queue will not submit invoices and credit memos to AvaTax as transaction submissions are disabled.

field.label: Queue Processing Type
field.comment: Normal Queue Processing - each item of Queue will be processed separately. Batch Queue Processing - Queue will be processed by 1000 items batch.

field.label: Enable Queue Admin Notification
field.comment: A notification will be displayed at the top of any admin page if there are pending queue records waiting to be submitted to AvaTax but no attempts have been made in the last 24 hours to submit them.

field.label: Enable Queue Failure Notification
field.comment: A notification will be displayed at the top of any admin page if there are any failed queue records.

field.label: Max Queue Retry Attempts
field.comment: Please enter a number 1 or greater in this field.

field.label: Complete Queue Lifetime
field.comment: Required. Days before entries are auto-purged.

field.label: Failed Queue Lifetime
field.comment: Required. Days before entries are auto-purged.
